dialogues.text: A patient is lifted from a hydro tank, the complex water vessel in which burn patients are treated. He lies perfectly still, hands and face swathed in gauze; A 20th- century mummy. Tubes and wires.poke from his body. We hear the steady beeping of a cardiogram.

dialogues.speaker: MASKED BURN NURSES 108
dialogues.text: carefully strap the mummy onto a hydraulically powered, multi-axied burn platform. Behind him are other bandaged patients, some rotating on burn platforms, some still submerged in their hydro-tanks.

dialogues.speaker: THE RESIDENT PHYSICIAN AND FOUR INTERNS
dialogues.text: saunter over to the hydraulic bed where nurses adjust the patient's I.V. tubing. RESIDENT

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Here we have a 25-30 year-old-male, no I.D., no medical history. Fished the guy out of the river with burns covering over forty percent of his body. His hands and.face were the most severe. 110

dialogues.speaker: A BURN NURSE
dialogues.text: pushes a button. Motors grinding, the hydraulic platform rotates, slowly spinning the mummified man. For a brief moment he is upside down. RESIDENT

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Ten years ago, pain from the burns would have been intolerable. The guy would have spent the rest of his screaming. Now we use the Rangeveritz technique; quite simply, we sever his spino-thalamic nerve... 111

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: 111 ZIIIP! He extends a telescoping steel pointer and to indicates a spot just above Pey RESIDENT

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: .Here. Which, as you know, transmits neural-impulses of pain and vibratory sense to the brain.
112 ZIIIP! He collapses the pointer and returns it to his pocket. 113

dialogues.speaker: THE HYDRAULIC BURN PLATFORM
dialogues.text: continues its slow rotation with the mummified patient now turned sideways. RESIDENT

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: No longer receiving impulses of pain, you stick him with a pin...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: He jabs a sterilized needle deep into the bandaged knee. Interns gasp. The resident leaves the pin in the knee for dramatic effect. RESIDENT

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: .and he can't even feel it. With a sharp practiced motion, he plucks out the pin. 115

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: His eyes still closed. No response. RESIDENT

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Of course, there are serious emotional side effects to this operation. When the body ceases to feel, when so much sensory input is lost, the patient becomes alienated. The mind, cut off from its regular diet of input, has a never-satisfied thirst; alienation gives rise to loneliness, anger; uncontrolled rage is not uncommon. And the rage problem is exacerbated by the chemical effect of severing the nerve. Now, surges of adrenaline flow unchecked through body and brain-- giving him the strength of dozen men. Hence the leather restraints. The resident turns and heads for the door. The interns follow behind like ducklings. 116 I

dialogues.text: StrackГўВЂВћ naked except for a monogrammed bath towel wrapd around his thickening midriff, walks across the plush bedroom of his penthouse apartment. A Mahler symphony plays in the background. He bends to hoist a huge inlaid mahogany chest that rests on a marble stand, 'then, grunting under the strain of the load, he staggers back across the room to the king-sized bed. With a mighty heave he tips the contents of the chest out onto the bed. A torrent of golden ICrugerands. They wash over the bed, so many that some spill over the sides and clatter to the floor. Strack pauses for a beat, staring down at the booty, then reaches down to the towel and lets it drop to the floor. Like a swan he dives. He rolls, luxuriating in the feel of gold against flesh, laughter bubbling from his lips. Gold coins stick to his flushed, sweating flesh, then slough off, leaving their imprint. Strack makes swimming motions with his arms, laving himself with the golden coins-- A knock at the door. Strack freezes. STRACK

dialogues.text: The ladder snaps taut against the hook.

dialogues.speaker: HE LI C
dialogues.text: We are about to be obliterated. 441

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: 441 Pilot is yanking on the collective; the chopper whine PILOT

dialogues.speaker: P441 THE OVERPASS
dialogues.text: rushing up. P442

dialogues.speaker: P442 TRUCK ROOF
dialogues.text: Wind whipping at his coat, looking up at the doomed helicopter, the Darkman bellows in triumph. B442

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: B442 Wind whipping at his coat looking up at the doomed helicopter, the Darkman bellows his triumph. P443 P443 OVERPASS

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: taking up the entire screen. --impact--KABOOM! P444 P444 TUNNEL B444

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: B444 Darkman, LAUGHING on the truck, races through the darkness, 444A

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: 444A flaming debris from the helicopter cascading over the mouth of the tunnel. CDT TO:

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Strack sits behind his power desk, talking into the phone.. STRACK

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: We've consolidated the waterfront, Governor ...Yes, I'm aware there's been some unpleasantness but that's over now. Yes, I'm sure. You sound a little nervous, Bryant. Have a brandy, watch a cop show. The door opens. A security officer appears. SECURITY OFFICER

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Robert Durant, sir. STRACK (PLEASED)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Send him in. (TO PHONE)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Goodbye, Governor. Everything's taken care of. He hangs up. We hear the door open and close. Strack's smile vanishes. ROBERT DURANT

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: enters. He looks awful--face scorched and bruised, severe limp. STRACK

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You look like hell, Robert. DURANT

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The son of a bitch malfunctioned my helicopter. STRACK

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: And Westlake? CONTINUED

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (Revised scene numbers 2-17-89) 161. 445 CONTINUE DURANT

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: 'f ie man's a cockroach. You think you ;tall him, and he pops up someplace , Ise. A beat. STRACK

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: g expect he'll pop up here soon. (PRESSES INTERCOM)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: if Westlake calls, kindly refer him to Strack Towers. (TO DURANT)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Come, Robert, let us kill the girl. CUT TO: B446

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: RATTLING up the steel skeleton of a skyscraper, P44

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: P446 stars all around us. STRACK

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I'm glad you survived, Robert. I'd hate to see your kids deprived of a role-model. DURANT

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: They do look up to me. The elevator grinds to a halt and the two emerge. The lights of the city tremble over the water. A glitter and breadth to the landscape, an urban grandeur. STRACK

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Kids need an example, Robert. When I was a young man my father made me work high steel. That's how he started out, and in his view what was good enough for him was good enough for me... CONTINUED

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (Revised Scenes 2-17-89) 162. P446 CONTIKUED

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Strack gestures broadly with one arm. STRACK

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: ...It was just me and the Indians, no one else crazy enough to run around up here, against the wind, four-fifty an hour. Sure I resented it, but now-- call me crazy--sometimes I miss it, it sharpens your wits. Life on the edge. Five inches wide. Two hundred fifty feet down. High steel... He turns to face Durant. There's a gun in his hand. STRACK

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You don't have any kids, Robert. DURANT

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: What are you talking about? STRACK

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Or should I say, Doctor Westlake? DUR ANT

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I'm Durant! Robert G. Durant! STRACK

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Then I'm going to make a mistake. There's a long beat. The vein begins to pulse on Durant's temple. His eyes grow predatory, evil. DURANT/ DARMAN (RASPS)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Where's the girl? Strack hops nimbly out onto a narrow girder. He smiles back over his shoulder. STRACK

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You want to see the girl? Follow me, I'll take you to her... Durant/Darkman follows, taking the first few tentative steps. CONTINUED

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (Revised Scene Is Z-37-89) 163.

dialogues.speaker: P446 CONTINU3
dialogues.text: STRACK

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: ...I must say, Dr. Westlake, you've certainly worked some mischief. Pretty much wiped out the security arm of Strack Industries. That's okay. I'm a good sport... He leaps from beam to beam, Durant/Darkman following cautiously behind. STRACK

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: ...And I can handle my own problems. I do whatever I have to do. In fact, that's how I got my first properties. My wife--late wife--held certain deeds... I sent her on a plane trip over the Smokies and well, let's just say ;landed on My feet... (SHRUGS)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: .as for my father, well, he was old, I spared him a few miserable years... Yes, we all have dreams, Dr. Westlake, but we don't all have what it takes to realize those dreams. DURANT/DARKMAN

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: All I have are nightmares. A beat. STRACK

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Then share my dream. After all, you and I are pretty much the same. We should be working together. Both smart fellows. Similar styles. Same taste in women. I could use a man like you.

dialogues.speaker: DURANT/DART AN
dialogues.text: (RASPS)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Go to hell. STRACK

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Eventually, eventually... He proceeds nimbly along the beam. CONTINUED

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (Revised Scene #s2-17-89) 164. P446 CONTINUED(3) STRACK

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I guess you just don't have what it takes. I gather you run around wearing other people's faces now, since yours is so... loathsome. He shrugs. STRACK

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: .See I could never do that. The world has to take me as I am. And all this tit-for- tat stuff you've been up to. Silly. Living in the past. ; only destroy to build something better, whereas You..ГўВЂВў ah, here we are. 447

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: 447 Julie stands out on the end of a projecting girder, a the furthest extremity of the growing building. Wind whips at her hair and dress; she clings pathetically to an upright. DURANT/DARKMAN

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Julie! Strack laughs. STRACK

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Bring on the strings! Young lovers! In peril! Separated by ruthless forces, larger than they!--What a banal tale. In it, I suppose I play the villain. But wait, Julie--which of us is the monster here?! With this he reaches over to Durant and--SQUISHHHRIPPP!! -- tears his face off, tossing it over the edge.. 448

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: 448 The face spins down, whooshing end over end, the wind flapping it this way and that. On the way down it slaps against the occasional girder, momentarily flattening out into the recognizable face of Durant, and then peels away again. It spins downward towards a forest of reinforcing bars that form a pungi pit of steel spikes in the open foundation below. Finally it lands--splat-- pierced through the eye by one of the rusty re-bars.
449 449 JULIE

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: gazes at Darkman's ghastly visage for the first time, overcome by horror and repulsion. Darkman's vein pulses like csa y.. Strack"s tone is almost admiring:

dialogues.speaker: STR.ACK
dialogues.text: You truly are one ugly son of a bitch.

dialogues.speaker: BLAM
dialogues.text: Strack shoots Darkman in the shoulder, hurling him off the bean. The Darkman tumbles, limbs flailing, bellowing with rage. THE WORLD

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Spinning upside down--stars, abyss, stars, abyss-- GIRDER

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: As Darkman's fingertips clamp onto the upper lip of an I-beam... barely hanging on, vein pulsing.

dialogues.speaker: ON THE UPPER GIRDER
dialogues.text: Strack looks down, wind whipping his hair. HIS POV-- nothing. Darkman has been swallowed up by the night. Pocketing his gun, Strack proceeds toward Julie. JULIE

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: recoils as Strack stops in front of her. He touches her hair. STRACK (WITH REMORSE)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: First my wife, then my father, and now YOU--

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: He places his hands on her shoulders, preparing to push her off the girder. With intensity: CONTINUED
449 CONTINUEN STRACK

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: -It is the tragedy of my life that I always have to kill the ones I love. As he's about to push her:

dialogues.speaker: A VOICE BEHIND HIM
dialogues.text: IDuis ! Strack turns around. 450

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: 4 5 0 STRACK St. stands behind him, glaring angrily. STRACK JR. Father? STRACK SR. (HORRIBLE RASP)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I should've snuffed you out at birth! With that Strack Sr. rips off his own face, exposing the enraged visage of Darkman... Strack reaches for his gun. 451

dialogues.speaker: BAM
dialogues.text: Darkman mashes his face and the gun flies out of his hand into the darkness below.

dialogues.speaker: STRACK AND DARXMAN
dialogues.text: OF

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: battle it out on the narrow girder, hundreds of feet sure death on either side of them.

dialogues.speaker: BAM
dialogues.text: Savage punches send Strack reeling--BAM!--he falls onto the girder... nearby are a bunch of tools... Strack crawls toward them. CONTINUED
451 CONTI1rn D 451

dialogues.speaker: A RIVET GUN
dialogues.text: only a few inches from his grasp. DARIOM

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: swoops onto Strack, pummelling him. STRACR'S HAND

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: inching painfully toward the rivet gun. DARKMAN

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: pummelling, lost in the act of his final revenge. He steps back to give a final blow... .and slips on some loose rivets, flailing for balance. STRACK

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: lunges. CLANG! Darkman slams into a vertical bar.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: 452 The rivet gun shoots a bolt through Darkman's wrist, then the other wrist--pinning him to the I-beam... Strack takes a step backward, exhausted. 453 453 STRACK STRACK

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Now you get to watch your girl-friend die. He moves toward a terrified Julie. DARXMAN

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: SHRIEKS and reality melts around him as he tastes the hot soup of rage.

dialogues.speaker: CRACK
dialogues.text: Gigantic fissures appear on all the girders... we spin into Darkman's eyeball to find--

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Nightmarish flashes of laughing faces jeering into the camera; Julie and Strack kissing, naked. 456 Strack's face bobs, attached now to the body of the 4 dunking bird, his nose nearing the ignition of a huge lighter. As contact is made the lighter explodes in a shower of gold Krugerands. 457 The gold coins fall away to reveal Peyton's unscathed head, bobbing on a freakish and deformed doll's body. Atop a circus platform, he does an angry jig. He wears a funny little hat. 458 Peyton's face liquefies and flows off his head to rev the face of the Darkman. 459 A drop of liquid Peyton falls upon... A cube of ice. bursts into flames. 460 The camera races back from Darkman's eye.. his vein 4 pulsing madly.

dialogues.speaker: DARXMAN'S RIVETED HAND 461
dialogues.text: insensitive to pain, he pulls, every sinew concentrated on the task. GGGGGGGG ! A horrible grating sounds as the first rivet rips through steel... One hand is freed. GGGGGGG ! .The other is freed. 462 STRACK 462

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: with his back to him, doesn't have a chance to turn as: CONTINUED
462 CONTINUED DARKMAN

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: pounces. He lifts him full into the air. Strack's legs and arms flail impotently. DARKMAN

dialogues.speaker: ARRRRRRRGGGGGGG
dialogues.text: Darkman hurls him up, up into the air. 463 Strack rises helpless, flailing his limbs... then beg to fall, yards away from the girder. 464 He spins, end over end, to--PPHHHHFFFTHHMP!--be impal on the rebars many floors below, next to Durant's face. CUT TO:

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: HUMMING at the cut. Darkman and Julie are inside. Darkman remains turned from Julie, facing the shadows. Gently, Julie touches his shoulder to draw him toward her. JULIE

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Peyton, I can help. DARKMAN

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: No one can help. JULIE

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I don't care how you look, Peyton! I. love you. The burns don't matter. There's a long pause. Then Darkman turns the twisted remains of. his face toward her. Julie sees them in close-up. CLAMP! The elevator jars to a halt on street level. CONTINUED
465 CONTINUED DARKMAN

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Take my hand. Julie stares at the charred skeletal fingers. She overcomes her repulsion and puts her hand in his. DARKMAN

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: It disgusts you. JULIE

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: No. Darkman stares at her a long time, anguished, torn. FINALLY: DARKMAN

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: This hand... it used to caress you. Now it can only tear, rip away at things. JULIE (ANXIOUS; PERSUASIVE)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: But you'll perfect the skin. You'll get rid of the scars. DARKMAN

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: It's not just the scars. I've changed- He grips his skull. DARKMAN

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: --inside. He pulls the elevator open. DARKMAN (BEAT)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I can live with it now, but I don't think anyone else can. JULIE

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (tears in her EYES)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I want it back. The two of us--the way it was... Darkman's voice breaks: CONTINUED
465 CONTINUED(2) DARKMAN

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: What we had--our life together--it belonged in the light of day. He disappears into the darkness. JULIE

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Peyton! Darkman's voice floats back as he stalks away: DARKMAN

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Peyton is gone... 466 He heads into the shadows. At the edge of the darknes he pulls a mask from his coat and disappears behind a construction trailer. A pedestrian reappears on the other side. Julie knows it's!Darkman. She chases after him but he slips into the pedestrian traffic. The camera hurries down the street with Julie as she desperately searches for him, turning people around, staring at their faces... It begins to snow. JULIE

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Peyton! She rushes from pedestrian to pedestrian, staring into alien faces in search of the man she loves.

dialogues.speaker: AS WE ROLL END CREDITS
dialogues.text: The camera pulls back into the crowd of pedestrians, any one of who could be Darkman... We continue to pull back, down avenues and side-streets, byways, courtyards, wherever the crowd spills, into an alley... As a street- person shuffles into view:

dialogues.speaker: A MUSCULAR HAND 467
dialogues.text: snaps open a switch-blade. A second set of arms grabs the street person and spins him around, revealing--
467 CONTINUED

dialogues.speaker: THE CHARRED SKULL OF DARKMAN
dialogues.text: Wild, half-mad eyes gleam wickedly from boney sockets. Mandibles yank back and, through a lipless smile, he RASPS: DARKMAN
